com.att.research.xacmlatt.pdp.policy

Interface FunctionArgument

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ExpressionResult, ExpressionResultBoolean, FunctionArgumentAttributeValue, FunctionArgumentBag, FunctionArgumentExpression

    public interface FunctionArgument
    FunctionArgument is the interface implemented by objects that can serve as arguments to a FunctionDefinition evaluate call.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.3 $
    Author:
    car

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Bag getBag()
      Gets the Bag value for this FunctionArgument if the argument represents a Bag, (i.e.
      Status getStatus()
      Gets the Status from the evaluation of this FunctionArgument.
      AttributeValue<?> getValue()
      Gets the single AttributeValue representing the value of this FunctionArgument.
      boolean isBag()
      Determines if this FunctionArgument represents a bag of values.
      boolean isOk()
      Determines if this FunctionArgument is OK and can have its AttributeValue or Bag retrieved.

    • Method Detail

      • getStatus

        Status getStatus()
        Gets the Status from the evaluation of this FunctionArgument.
        Returns:
        the Status from the evaluation of this FunctionArgument>

      • isOk

        boolean isOk()
        Determines if this FunctionArgument is OK and can have its AttributeValue or Bag retrieved.
        Returns:
        true if this FunctionArgument is OK, otherwise false.

      • isBag

        boolean isBag()
        Determines if this FunctionArgument represents a bag of values.
        Returns:
        true if this FunctionArgument represents a bag of values, else false.

      • getValue

        AttributeValue<?> getValue()
        Gets the single AttributeValue representing the value of this FunctionArgument. If this FunctionArgument represents a bag, the value returned is up to the implementation.
        Returns:
        the single AttributeValue representing the value of this FunctionArgument.

      • getBag

        Bag getBag()
        Gets the Bag value for this FunctionArgument if the argument represents a Bag, (i.e. isBag returns true).
        Returns:
        the Bag value for this FunctionArgument.
